history.content:
-Goal-
Given a text document that may or may not be structured into chapters, sections, and articles, and a list of entity types, identify all entities of those types from the text and all relationships among the identified entities.

-Mandatory Structural Rules-
- Each article (제 X 조) must be extracted as a distinct entity.
- All "Article X"s in the document must be extracted as entities without omission. Not a single one can be missing.
- If multiple articles are combined into one chunk, split them and extract each one separately as its own entity.
- The **entire content of each Article (제 X 조)** must be included verbatim or paraphrased in the `entity_description` of the corresponding `ARTICLE` entity.
- The entity_description must end with the following string in Korean: "이 내용은 [headline] 문서에서 추출함. [page]페이지에 위치함."
- Details within an article (such as 항 or 항목) must be nested or clearly described as part of that article’s entity_description.
- Each article must be related to its upper-level chapter(장) or section(절).
- Articles within the same chapter or section should be linked with inferred relationships if their contents are semantically related.

-Steps-
1. Identify all entities. For each identified entity, extract the following information:
- entity_name: Name of the entity, capitalized
- entity_type: One of the following types: [organization,person,geo,event,date,room,phone]
- entity_description: 반드시 **한국어로 작성**하십시오. 해당 엔터티의 성격, 역할, 포함된 내용을 한국어로 서술합니다.
Format each entity as ("entity"<|><entity_name><|><entity_type><|><entity_description>)
 
2. From the entities identified in step 1, identify all pairs of (source_entity, target_entity) that are *clearly related* to each other.
For each pair of related entities, extract the following information:
- source_entity: name of the source entity, as identified in step 1
- target_entity: name of the target entity, as identified in step 1
- relationship_description: explanation as to why you think the source entity and the target entity are related to each other
- relationship_strength: a numeric score indicating strength of the relationship between the source entity and target entity
 Format each relationship as ("relationship"<|><source_entity><|><target_entity><|><relationship_description><|><relationship_strength>)
 
3. Return output in **Korean** as a single list of all the entities and relationships identified in steps 1 and 2. Use **##** as the list delimiter.
 
4. When finished, output <|COMPLETE|>

######################
-Examples-
######################
Example 1:

Text:
Title: Hansung University Computer Engineering Department Teaching Assistant Recruitment Announcement
Content:
Hello, this is the administrative assistant from the Department of Computer Engineering.
Currently, we are recruiting administrative and teaching assistants for the Department of Computer Engineering.

1. Recruitment Fields
- Administrative Assistant (Day shift) or Teaching Assistant (Day shift)
- Number of openings: 1 for each (select either Administrative or Teaching Assistant)

2. Qualifications
- Academic requirement: A bachelor's degree or higher
- Must not have any disqualifying factors for assistant appointment
- Preferred: Majors in IT or Computer-related fields

3. Working Conditions
- 5 days a week, daytime
- Daytime: 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM
- During vacation periods: 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM
- Expected start date: December 15, 2024
- Administrative Assistant: Hansung University Jiseong Building 105, IT Engineering Academic Team Office
- Teaching Assistant: Hansung University Engineering Building A 104, Department of Computer Engineering Office
- Contract: 1 year (renewable once for up to 2 years)

4. Documents to Submit
- Resume (use the attached format, include a photo)
- Submission deadline: November 29, Friday

5. Recruitment Process
- 1st round: Document review (Only candidates selected will be notified individually)
- 2nd round: Interview (Only for those who pass the first round)
- Additional documents for successful candidates: University graduation certificate, transcript, resident registration, etc. to be provided later.

######################

content: (시행일) 본 변경세칙은 2004년 11월 11일부터 시행한다. 부 칙 (시행일) 본 변경세칙은 2004년 12월 9일부터 시행한다. 부 칙 (시행일) 본 변경세칙은 2005년 2월 3일부터 시행한다. 부 칙 (시행일) 본 변경세칙은 2005년 2월 24일부터 시행한다. (경과조치) 이 세칙 개정 당시에 석사 4학기자(교육대학원 5학기 자) 이상, 박사 5학기 자 이상은 공개 발표를 면제할 수 있다. 부 칙 (시행일) 본 변경세칙은 2005년 5월 4일부터 시행한다. 부 칙 (시행일) 본 변경세칙은 2005년 11월 1일부터 시행한다. (경과조치) 이 세칙 시행이전 대학원에 재적하고 있는 학생은 재적기간동안 직전 세칙을 적용한다. 부 칙 (시행일) 본 변경세칙은 2005년 12월 1일부터 시행한다. (경과조치) 이 세칙 시행이전 대학원에 재적하고 있는 학생은 재적기간동안 직전 세칙을 적용한다. 부 칙 (시행일) 본 변경세칙은 2006년 3월 1일부터 시행한다. (경과조치) 이 세칙 시행이전 대학원에 재적하고 있는 학생은 재적기간동안 직전 세칙을 적용한다.

details.prompt: MANY entities and relationships were missed in the last extraction. Remember to ONLY emit entities that match any of the previously extracted types. Add them below using the same format:

history.content:
-Goal-
Given a text document that may or may not be structured into chapters, sections, and articles, and a list of entity types, identify all entities of those types from the text and all relationships among the identified entities.

-Mandatory Structural Rules-
- Each article (제 X 조) must be extracted as a distinct entity.
- All "Article X"s in the document must be extracted as entities without omission. Not a single one can be missing.
- If multiple articles are combined into one chunk, split them and extract each one separately as its own entity.
- The **entire content of each Article (제 X 조)** must be included verbatim or paraphrased in the `entity_description` of the corresponding `ARTICLE` entity.
- The entity_description must end with the following string in Korean: "이 내용은 [headline] 문서에서 추출함. [page]페이지에 위치함."
- Details within an article (such as 항 or 항목) must be nested or clearly described as part of that article’s entity_description.
- Each article must be related to its upper-level chapter(장) or section(절).
- Articles within the same chapter or section should be linked with inferred relationships if their contents are semantically related.

-Steps-
1. Identify all entities. For each identified entity, extract the following information:
- entity_name: Name of the entity, capitalized
- entity_type: One of the following types: [organization,person,geo,event,date,room,phone]
- entity_description: 반드시 **한국어로 작성**하십시오. 해당 엔터티의 성격, 역할, 포함된 내용을 한국어로 서술합니다.
Format each entity as ("entity"<|><entity_name><|><entity_type><|><entity_description>)
 
2. From the entities identified in step 1, identify all pairs of (source_entity, target_entity) that are *clearly related* to each other.
For each pair of related entities, extract the following information:
- source_entity: name of the source entity, as identified in step 1
- target_entity: name of the target entity, as identified in step 1
- relationship_description: explanation as to why you think the source entity and the target entity are related to each other
- relationship_strength: a numeric score indicating strength of the relationship between the source entity and target entity
 Format each relationship as ("relationship"<|><source_entity><|><target_entity><|><relationship_description><|><relationship_strength>)
 
3. Return output in **Korean** as a single list of all the entities and relationships identified in steps 1 and 2. Use **##** as the list delimiter.
 
4. When finished, output <|COMPLETE|>

######################
-Examples-
######################
Example 1: 
Entity_types: ORGANIZATION,EVENT,CHAPTER,ARTICLE,PAGE
Text:
page: 1
headline: 가람교육재단 정관
content: 제 1 장 총 칙

page: 1
headline: 가람교육재단 정관
content: 제 1 장 제 1 조 (설립목적) 본 재단은 교육기관의 설립 및 운영을 통해 공익에 이바지함을 목적으로 한다.

page: 1
headline: 가람교육재단 정관
content: 제 1 장 제 2 조 (명칭) 본 재단의 명칭은 가람교육재단이라 한다. 

page: 1
headline: 가람교육재단 운영규정
content: 제 1 조 (목적) 이 규정은 가람교육재단의 운영에 필요한 사항을 정함을 목적으로 한다.

######################

("entity"<|>가람교육재단<|>ORGANIZATION<|>교육기관의 설립 및 운영을 통해 공익에 이바지하는 재단)

##

Example 3:
Entity_types: ORGANIZATION,GEO,PERSON,EVENT,DATE,ROOM
Text:
Title: Hansung University Computer Engineering Department Teaching Assistant Recruitment Announcement
Content:
Hello, this is the administrative assistant from the Department of Computer Engineering.
Currently, we are recruiting administrative and teaching assistants for the Department of Computer Engineering.

1. Recruitment Fields
- Administrative Assistant (Day shift) or Teaching Assistant (Day shift)
- Number of openings: 1 for each (select either Administrative or Teaching Assistant)

2. Qualifications
- Academic requirement: A bachelor's degree or higher
- Must not have any disqualifying factors for assistant appointment
- Preferred: Majors in IT or Computer-related fields

3. Working Conditions
- 5 days a week, daytime
- Daytime: 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM
- During vacation periods: 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM
- Expected start date: December 15, 2024
- Administrative Assistant: Hansung University Jiseong Building 105, IT Engineering Academic Team Office
- Teaching Assistant: Hansung University Engineering Building A 104, Department of Computer Engineering Office
- Contract: 1 year (renewable once for up to 2 years)

4. Documents to Submit
- Resume (use the attached format, include a photo)
- Submission deadline: November 29, Friday

5. Recruitment Process
- 1st round: Document review (Only candidates selected will be notified individually)
- 2nd round: Interview (Only for those who pass the first round)
- Additional documents for successful candidates: University graduation certificate, transcript, resident registration, etc. to be provided later.

######################

details.prompt: MANY entities and relationships were missed in the last extraction. Remember to ONLY emit entities that match any of the previously extracted types. Add them below using the same format:

history.content:
-Goal-
Given a text document that may or may not be structured into chapters, sections, and articles, and a list of entity types, identify all entities of those types from the text and all relationships among the identified entities.

-Mandatory Structural Rules-
- Each article (제 X 조) must be extracted as a distinct entity.
- All "Article X"s in the document must be extracted as entities without omission. Not a single one can be missing.
- If multiple articles are combined into one chunk, split them and extract each one separately as its own entity.
- The **entire content of each Article (제 X 조)** must be included verbatim or paraphrased in the `entity_description` of the corresponding `ARTICLE` entity.
- The entity_description must end with the following string in Korean: "이 내용은 [headline] 문서에서 추출함. [page]페이지에 위치함."
- Details within an article (such as 항 or 항목) must be nested or clearly described as part of that article’s entity_description.
- Each article must be related to its upper-level chapter(장) or section(절).
- Articles within the same chapter or section should be linked with inferred relationships if their contents are semantically related.

-Steps-
1. Identify all entities. For each identified entity, extract the following information:
- entity_name: Name of the entity, capitalized
- entity_type: One of the following types: [organization,person,geo,event,date,room,phone]
- entity_description: 반드시 **한국어로 작성**하십시오. 해당 엔터티의 성격, 역할, 포함된 내용을 한국어로 서술합니다.
Format each entity as ("entity"<|><entity_name><|><entity_type><|><entity_description>)
 
2. From the entities identified in step 1, identify all pairs of (source_entity, target_entity) that are *clearly related* to each other.
For each pair of related entities, extract the following information:
- source_entity: name of the source entity, as identified in step 1
- target_entity: name of the target entity, as identified in step 1
- relationship_description: explanation as to why you think the source entity and the target entity are related to each other
- relationship_strength: a numeric score indicating strength of the relationship between the source entity and target entity
 Format each relationship as ("relationship"<|><source_entity><|><target_entity><|><relationship_description><|><relationship_strength>)
 
3. Return output in **Korean** as a single list of all the entities and relationships identified in steps 1 and 2. Use **##** as the list delimiter.
 
4. When finished, output <|COMPLETE|>

######################
-Examples-
######################
Example 1: 
Entity_types: ORGANIZATION,EVENT,CHAPTER,ARTICLE,PAGE

headline: 가람교육재단 정관

page: 1

content: 제 1 장 제 2 조 (명칭) 본 재단의 명칭은 가람교육재단이라 한다. 

page: 1

Text:
Title: Hansung University Computer Engineering Department Teaching Assistant Recruitment Announcement
Content:
Hello, this is the administrative assistant from the Department of Computer Engineering.
Currently, we are recruiting administrative and teaching assistants for the Department of Computer Engineering.

1. Recruitment Fields
- Administrative Assistant (Day shift) or Teaching Assistant (Day shift)
- Number of openings: 1 for each (select either Administrative or Teaching Assistant)

2. Qualifications
- Academic requirement: A bachelor's degree or higher
- Must not have any disqualifying factors for assistant appointment
- Preferred: Majors in IT or Computer-related fields

3. Working Conditions
- 5 days a week, daytime
- Daytime: 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM
- During vacation periods: 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM
- Expected start date: December 15, 2024
- Administrative Assistant: Hansung University Jiseong Building 105, IT Engineering Academic Team Office
- Teaching Assistant: Hansung University Engineering Building A 104, Department of Computer Engineering Office
- Contract: 1 year (renewable once for up to 2 years)

4. Documents to Submit
- Resume (use the attached format, include a photo)
- Submission deadline: November 29, Friday

5. Recruitment Process
- 1st round: Document review (Only candidates selected will be notified individually)
- 2nd round: Interview (Only for those who pass the first round)
- Additional documents for successful candidates: University graduation certificate, transcript, resident registration, etc. to be provided later.

history.content:
-Goal-
Given a text document that may or may not be structured into chapters, sections, and articles, and a list of entity types, identify all entities of those types from the text and all relationships among the identified entities.

-Mandatory Structural Rules-
- Each article (제 X 조) must be extracted as a distinct entity.
- All "Article X"s in the document must be extracted as entities without omission. Not a single one can be missing.
- If multiple articles are combined into one chunk, split them and extract each one separately as its own entity.
- The **entire content of each Article (제 X 조)** must be included verbatim or paraphrased in the `entity_description` of the corresponding `ARTICLE` entity.
- The entity_description must end with the following string in Korean: "이 내용은 [headline] 문서에서 추출함. [page]페이지에 위치함."
- Details within an article (such as 항 or 항목) must be nested or clearly described as part of that article’s entity_description.
- Each article must be related to its upper-level chapter(장) or section(절).
- Articles within the same chapter or section should be linked with inferred relationships if their contents are semantically related.

-Steps-
1. Identify all entities. For each identified entity, extract the following information:
- entity_name: Name of the entity, capitalized
- entity_type: One of the following types: [organization,person,geo,event,date,room,phone]
- entity_description: 반드시 **한국어로 작성**하십시오. 해당 엔터티의 성격, 역할, 포함된 내용을 한국어로 서술합니다.
Format each entity as ("entity"<|><entity_name><|><entity_type><|><entity_description>)
 
2. From the entities identified in step 1, identify all pairs of (source_entity, target_entity) that are *clearly related* to each other.
For each pair of related entities, extract the following information:
- source_entity: name of the source entity, as identified in step 1
- target_entity: name of the target entity, as identified in step 1
- relationship_description: explanation as to why you think the source entity and the target entity are related to each other
- relationship_strength: a numeric score indicating strength of the relationship between the source entity and target entity
 Format each relationship as ("relationship"<|><source_entity><|><target_entity><|><relationship_description><|><relationship_strength>)
 
3. Return output in **Korean** as a single list of all the entities and relationships identified in steps 1 and 2. Use **##** as the list delimiter.
 
4. When finished, output <|COMPLETE|>

######################
-Examples-
######################

Hello, this is the administrative assistant from the Department of Computer Engineering.
Currently, we are recruiting administrative and teaching assistants for the Department of Computer Engineering.

1. Recruitment Fields
- Administrative Assistant (Day shift) or Teaching Assistant (Day shift)
- Number of openings: 1 for each (select either Administrative or Teaching Assistant)

2. Qualifications
- Academic requirement: A bachelor's degree or higher
- Must not have any disqualifying factors for assistant appointment
- Preferred: Majors in IT or Computer-related fields

3. Working Conditions
- 5 days a week, daytime
- Daytime: 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM
- During vacation periods: 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM
- Expected start date: December 15, 2024
- Administrative Assistant: Hansung University Jiseong Building 105, IT Engineering Academic Team Office
- Teaching Assistant: Hansung University Engineering Building A 104, Department of Computer Engineering Office
- Contract: 1 year (renewable once for up to 2 years)

4. Documents to Submit
- Resume (use the attached format, include a photo)
- Submission deadline: November 29, Friday

5. Recruitment Process
- 1st round: Document review (Only candidates selected will be notified individually)
- 2nd round: Interview (Only for those who pass the first round)
- Additional documents for successful candidates: University graduation certificate, transcript, resident registration, etc. to be provided later.

history.content:
-Goal-
Given a text document that may or may not be structured into chapters, sections, and articles, and a list of entity types, identify all entities of those types from the text and all relationships among the identified entities.

-Mandatory Structural Rules-
- Each article (제 X 조) must be extracted as a distinct entity.
- All "Article X"s in the document must be extracted as entities without omission. Not a single one can be missing.
- If multiple articles are combined into one chunk, split them and extract each one separately as its own entity.
- The **entire content of each Article (제 X 조)** must be included verbatim or paraphrased in the `entity_description` of the corresponding `ARTICLE` entity.
- The entity_description must end with the following string in Korean: "이 내용은 [headline] 문서에서 추출함. [page]페이지에 위치함."
- Details within an article (such as 항 or 항목) must be nested or clearly described as part of that article’s entity_description.
- Each article must be related to its upper-level chapter(장) or section(절).
- Articles within the same chapter or section should be linked with inferred relationships if their contents are semantically related.

-Steps-
1. Identify all entities. For each identified entity, extract the following information:
- entity_name: Name of the entity, capitalized
- entity_type: One of the following types: [organization,person,geo,event,date,room,phone]
- entity_description: 반드시 **한국어로 작성**하십시오. 해당 엔터티의 성격, 역할, 포함된 내용을 한국어로 서술합니다.
Format each entity as ("entity"<|><entity_name><|><entity_type><|><entity_description>)
 
2. From the entities identified in step 1, identify all pairs of (source_entity, target_entity) that are *clearly related* to each other.
For each pair of related entities, extract the following information:
- source_entity: name of the source entity, as identified in step 1
- target_entity: name of the target entity, as identified in step 1
- relationship_description: explanation as to why you think the source entity and the target entity are related to each other
- relationship_strength: a numeric score indicating strength of the relationship between the source entity and target entity
 Format each relationship as ("relationship"<|><source_entity><|><target_entity><|><relationship_description><|><relationship_strength>)
 
3. Return output in **Korean** as a single list of all the entities and relationships identified in steps 1 and 2. Use **##** as the list delimiter.
 
4. When finished, output <|COMPLETE|>

######################
-Examples-
######################
Example 1: 
Entity_types: ORGANIZATION,EVENT,CHAPTER,ARTICLE,PAGE
Text:
page: 1
headline: 가람교육재단 정관
content: 제 1 장 총 칙

headline: 가람교육재단 정관
content: 제 1 장 제 1 조 (설립목적) 본 재단은 교육기관의 설립 및 운영을 통해 공익에 이바지함을 목적으로 한다.

page: 1
headline: 가람교육재단 정관
content: 제 1 장 제 2 조 (명칭) 본 재단의 명칭은 가람교육재단이라 한다. 

page: 1
headline: 가람교육재단 운영규정
content: 제 1 조 (목적) 이 규정은 가람교육재단의 운영에 필요한 사항을 정함을 목적으로 한다.

######################

Content:
Hello, this is the administrative assistant from the Department of Computer Engineering.
Currently, we are recruiting administrative and teaching assistants for the Department of Computer Engineering.

1. Recruitment Fields
- Administrative Assistant (Day shift) or Teaching Assistant (Day shift)
- Number of openings: 1 for each (select either Administrative or Teaching Assistant)

2. Qualifications
- Academic requirement: A bachelor's degree or higher
- Must not have any disqualifying factors for assistant appointment
- Preferred: Majors in IT or Computer-related fields

3. Working Conditions
- 5 days a week, daytime
- Daytime: 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM
- During vacation periods: 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM
- Expected start date: December 15, 2024
- Administrative Assistant: Hansung University Jiseong Building 105, IT Engineering Academic Team Office
- Teaching Assistant: Hansung University Engineering Building A 104, Department of Computer Engineering Office
- Contract: 1 year (renewable once for up to 2 years)

4. Documents to Submit
- Resume (use the attached format, include a photo)
- Submission deadline: November 29, Friday

5. Recruitment Process
- 1st round: Document review (Only candidates selected will be notified individually)
- 2nd round: Interview (Only for those who pass the first round)
- Additional documents for successful candidates: University graduation certificate, transcript, resident registration, etc. to be provided later.

details.prompt: MANY entities and relationships were missed in the last extraction. Remember to ONLY emit entities that match any of the previously extracted types. Add them below using the same format:

history.content:
-Goal-
Given a text document that may or may not be structured into chapters, sections, and articles, and a list of entity types, identify all entities of those types from the text and all relationships among the identified entities.

-Mandatory Structural Rules-
- Each article (제 X 조) must be extracted as a distinct entity.
- All "Article X"s in the document must be extracted as entities without omission. Not a single one can be missing.
- If multiple articles are combined into one chunk, split them and extract each one separately as its own entity.
- The **entire content of each Article (제 X 조)** must be included verbatim or paraphrased in the `entity_description` of the corresponding `ARTICLE` entity.
- The entity_description must end with the following string in Korean: "이 내용은 [headline] 문서에서 추출함. [page]페이지에 위치함."
- Details within an article (such as 항 or 항목) must be nested or clearly described as part of that article’s entity_description.
- Each article must be related to its upper-level chapter(장) or section(절).
- Articles within the same chapter or section should be linked with inferred relationships if their contents are semantically related.

-Steps-
1. Identify all entities. For each identified entity, extract the following information:
- entity_name: Name of the entity, capitalized
- entity_type: One of the following types: [organization,person,geo,event,date,room,phone]
- entity_description: 반드시 **한국어로 작성**하십시오. 해당 엔터티의 성격, 역할, 포함된 내용을 한국어로 서술합니다.
Format each entity as ("entity"<|><entity_name><|><entity_type><|><entity_description>)
 
2. From the entities identified in step 1, identify all pairs of (source_entity, target_entity) that are *clearly related* to each other.
For each pair of related entities, extract the following information:
- source_entity: name of the source entity, as identified in step 1
- target_entity: name of the target entity, as identified in step 1
- relationship_description: explanation as to why you think the source entity and the target entity are related to each other
- relationship_strength: a numeric score indicating strength of the relationship between the source entity and target entity
 Format each relationship as ("relationship"<|><source_entity><|><target_entity><|><relationship_description><|><relationship_strength>)
 
3. Return output in **Korean** as a single list of all the entities and relationships identified in steps 1 and 2. Use **##** as the list delimiter.
 
4. When finished, output <|COMPLETE|>

######################
-Examples-
######################
Example 1: 
Entity_types: ORGANIZATION,EVENT,CHAPTER,ARTICLE,PAGE
Text:
page: 1
headline: 가람교육재단 정관
content: 제 1 장 총 칙

page: 1
headline: 가람교육재단 정관
content: 제 1 장 제 1 조 (설립목적) 본 재단은 교육기관의 설립 및 운영을 통해 공익에 이바지함을 목적으로 한다.

page: 1
headline: 가람교육재단 정관
content: 제 1 장 제 2 조 (명칭) 본 재단의 명칭은 가람교육재단이라 한다. 

page: 1
headline: 가람교육재단 운영규정
content: 제 1 조 (목적) 이 규정은 가람교육재단의 운영에 필요한 사항을 정함을 목적으로 한다.

######################
Output:

Title: Hansung University Computer Engineering Department Teaching Assistant Recruitment Announcement
Content:
Hello, this is the administrative assistant from the Department of Computer Engineering.
Currently, we are recruiting administrative and teaching assistants for the Department of Computer Engineering.

1. Recruitment Fields
- Administrative Assistant (Day shift) or Teaching Assistant (Day shift)
- Number of openings: 1 for each (select either Administrative or Teaching Assistant)

2. Qualifications
- Academic requirement: A bachelor's degree or higher
- Must not have any disqualifying factors for assistant appointment
- Preferred: Majors in IT or Computer-related fields

3. Working Conditions
- 5 days a week, daytime
- Daytime: 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM
- During vacation periods: 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM
- Expected start date: December 15, 2024
- Administrative Assistant: Hansung University Jiseong Building 105, IT Engineering Academic Team Office
- Teaching Assistant: Hansung University Engineering Building A 104, Department of Computer Engineering Office
- Contract: 1 year (renewable once for up to 2 years)

4. Documents to Submit
- Resume (use the attached format, include a photo)
- Submission deadline: November 29, Friday

5. Recruitment Process
- 1st round: Document review (Only candidates selected will be notified individually)
- 2nd round: Interview (Only for those who pass the first round)
- Additional documents for successful candidates: University graduation certificate, transcript, resident registration, etc. to be provided later.

history.content:
-Goal-
Given a text document that may or may not be structured into chapters, sections, and articles, and a list of entity types, identify all entities of those types from the text and all relationships among the identified entities.

-Mandatory Structural Rules-
- Each article (제 X 조) must be extracted as a distinct entity.
- All "Article X"s in the document must be extracted as entities without omission. Not a single one can be missing.
- If multiple articles are combined into one chunk, split them and extract each one separately as its own entity.
- The **entire content of each Article (제 X 조)** must be included verbatim or paraphrased in the `entity_description` of the corresponding `ARTICLE` entity.
- The entity_description must end with the following string in Korean: "이 내용은 [headline] 문서에서 추출함. [page]페이지에 위치함."
- Details within an article (such as 항 or 항목) must be nested or clearly described as part of that article’s entity_description.
- Each article must be related to its upper-level chapter(장) or section(절).
- Articles within the same chapter or section should be linked with inferred relationships if their contents are semantically related.

-Steps-
1. Identify all entities. For each identified entity, extract the following information:
- entity_name: Name of the entity, capitalized
- entity_type: One of the following types: [organization,person,geo,event,date,room,phone]
- entity_description: 반드시 **한국어로 작성**하십시오. 해당 엔터티의 성격, 역할, 포함된 내용을 한국어로 서술합니다.
Format each entity as ("entity"<|><entity_name><|><entity_type><|><entity_description>)
 
2. From the entities identified in step 1, identify all pairs of (source_entity, target_entity) that are *clearly related* to each other.
For each pair of related entities, extract the following information:
- source_entity: name of the source entity, as identified in step 1
- target_entity: name of the target entity, as identified in step 1
- relationship_description: explanation as to why you think the source entity and the target entity are related to each other
- relationship_strength: a numeric score indicating strength of the relationship between the source entity and target entity
 Format each relationship as ("relationship"<|><source_entity><|><target_entity><|><relationship_description><|><relationship_strength>)
 
3. Return output in **Korean** as a single list of all the entities and relationships identified in steps 1 and 2. Use **##** as the list delimiter.
 
4. When finished, output <|COMPLETE|>

######################
-Examples-
######################

Currently, we are recruiting administrative and teaching assistants for the Department of Computer Engineering.

- Number of openings: 1 for each (select either Administrative or Teaching Assistant)

2. Qualifications
- Academic requirement: A bachelor's degree or higher
- Must not have any disqualifying factors for assistant appointment
- Preferred: Majors in IT or Computer-related fields

3. Working Conditions

- During vacation periods: 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM
- Expected start date: December 15, 2024
- Administrative Assistant: Hansung University Jiseong Building 105, IT Engineering Academic Team Office
- Teaching Assistant: Hansung University Engineering Building A 104, Department of Computer Engineering Office
- Contract: 1 year (renewable once for up to 2 years)

4. Documents to Submit
- Resume (use the attached format, include a photo)
- Submission deadline: November 29, Friday

5. Recruitment Process
- 1st round: Document review (Only candidates selected will be notified individually)
- 2nd round: Interview (Only for those who pass the first round)
- Additional documents for successful candidates: University graduation certificate, transcript, resident registration, etc. to be provided later.

history.content:
-Goal-
Given a text document that may or may not be structured into chapters, sections, and articles, and a list of entity types, identify all entities of those types from the text and all relationships among the identified entities.

-Mandatory Structural Rules-
- Each article (제 X 조) must be extracted as a distinct entity.
- All "Article X"s in the document must be extracted as entities without omission. Not a single one can be missing.
- If multiple articles are combined into one chunk, split them and extract each one separately as its own entity.
- The **entire content of each Article (제 X 조)** must be included verbatim or paraphrased in the `entity_description` of the corresponding `ARTICLE` entity.
- The entity_description must end with the following string in Korean: "이 내용은 [headline] 문서에서 추출함. [page]페이지에 위치함."
- Details within an article (such as 항 or 항목) must be nested or clearly described as part of that article’s entity_description.
- Each article must be related to its upper-level chapter(장) or section(절).
- Articles within the same chapter or section should be linked with inferred relationships if their contents are semantically related.

-Steps-
1. Identify all entities. For each identified entity, extract the following information:
- entity_name: Name of the entity, capitalized
- entity_type: One of the following types: [organization,person,geo,event,date,room,phone]
- entity_description: 반드시 **한국어로 작성**하십시오. 해당 엔터티의 성격, 역할, 포함된 내용을 한국어로 서술합니다.
Format each entity as ("entity"<|><entity_name><|><entity_type><|><entity_description>)
 
2. From the entities identified in step 1, identify all pairs of (source_entity, target_entity) that are *clearly related* to each other.
For each pair of related entities, extract the following information:
- source_entity: name of the source entity, as identified in step 1
- target_entity: name of the target entity, as identified in step 1
- relationship_description: explanation as to why you think the source entity and the target entity are related to each other
- relationship_strength: a numeric score indicating strength of the relationship between the source entity and target entity
 Format each relationship as ("relationship"<|><source_entity><|><target_entity><|><relationship_description><|><relationship_strength>)
 
3. Return output in **Korean** as a single list of all the entities and relationships identified in steps 1 and 2. Use **##** as the list delimiter.
 
4. When finished, output <|COMPLETE|>

######################
-Examples-
######################

Title: Hansung University Computer Engineering Department Teaching Assistant Recruitment Announcement
Content:
Hello, this is the administrative assistant from the Department of Computer Engineering.
Currently, we are recruiting administrative and teaching assistants for the Department of Computer Engineering.

1. Recruitment Fields
- Administrative Assistant (Day shift) or Teaching Assistant (Day shift)
- Number of openings: 1 for each (select either Administrative or Teaching Assistant)

2. Qualifications
- Academic requirement: A bachelor's degree or higher
- Must not have any disqualifying factors for assistant appointment
- Preferred: Majors in IT or Computer-related fields

3. Working Conditions
- 5 days a week, daytime
- Daytime: 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM
- During vacation periods: 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM
- Expected start date: December 15, 2024
- Administrative Assistant: Hansung University Jiseong Building 105, IT Engineering Academic Team Office
- Teaching Assistant: Hansung University Engineering Building A 104, Department of Computer Engineering Office
- Contract: 1 year (renewable once for up to 2 years)

4. Documents to Submit
- Resume (use the attached format, include a photo)
- Submission deadline: November 29, Friday

5. Recruitment Process
- 1st round: Document review (Only candidates selected will be notified individually)
- 2nd round: Interview (Only for those who pass the first round)
- Additional documents for successful candidates: University graduation certificate, transcript, resident registration, etc. to be provided later.

headline: 3-2-17 조교에 관한 규정
content:  제 7 조 (임용기간) 조교의 임용기간은 다음과 같다. ① 조교의 임용기간은 1년을 원칙으로 한다. 단, 본교 재직기간은 2년을 초과할 수 없다. (2006. 2. 7) (2007. 5. 2) (2019.2.26.) ② 삭제 (2019.2.26.) ③ 소속변경 조교의 임용기간은 본인의 임용기간을 따른다.(2019.2.26.) ④ 계약기간이 만료 시 당연 퇴직한다. (2012. 9. 1) (2019.2.26.) ⑤ 근무부적격자로 판정된 자에게는 해임통보와 같은 별도의 인사발령 조치 없이 계약기간이 만료되 는 날에 당연 퇴직한다. (2012. 9. 1)(2015.10.27)

page: 2
headline: 3-2-17 조교에 관한 규정
content:  제 8 조 (근무시간) 조교의 근무 기준시간은 다음과 같다.(2019.2.26.) 1. 행정조교 : 주당 40시간 2. 교육조교 : 주당 40시간 3. 연구조교 : 주당 30시간

page: 2
headline: 3-2-17 조교에 관한 규정
content:  제 9 조 (보수) 조교에게 급여를 지급하며, 이에 대한 세부사항은 총장이 따로 정한다. 단, 교육조교 중 면 학장학생인 경우, 본교 대학원 장학금지급 규정에 의한다. (2005. 9.20) (2006. 2. 7) (2006.12.20.) (2007. 5. 2)

page: 2
headline: 3-2-17 조교에 관한 규정
content:  제 10 조 (복무) 조교는 근무 중 다음사항을 성실히 이행하여야 한다. ① 조교는 맡은 임무를 성실히 이행해야 하며, 관련
######################
Output:

("entity"<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 6 조<|>ARTICLE<|>제 6 조 임용절차: 학부(과) 조교는 교무처장의 제청으로, 행정부서 조교는 총무처장 의 제청으로 총장이 임명한다. 신규 임용되는 조교는 신규 및 재임용 시 직종별 근로계약서를 체결하여야 한다. 이 내용은 3-2-17 조교에 관한 규정 문서에서 추출함. 2페이지에 위치함.)
##
("entity"<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 7 조<|>ARTICLE<|>제 7 조 임용기간: 조교의 임용기간은 1년을 원칙으로 하며, 본교 재직기간은 2년을 초과할 수 없다. 계약기간이 만료 시 당연 퇴직하며, 근무부적격자로 판정된 자는 해임통보 없이 계약기간 만료 시 당연 퇴직한다. 이 내용은 3-2-17 조교에 관한 규정 문서에서 추출함. 2페이지에 위치함.)
##
("entity"<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 8 조<|>ARTICLE<|>제 8 조 근무시간: 조교의 근무 기준시간은 행정조교와 교육조교는 주당 40시간, 연구조교는 주당 30시간으로 정해진다. 이 내용은 3-2-17 조교에 관한 규정 문서에서 추출함. 2페이지에 위치함.)
##
("entity"<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 9 조<|>ARTICLE<|>제 9 조 보수: 조교에게 급여를 지급하며, 세부사항은 총장이 따로 정한다. 교육조교 중 면학장학생인 경우, 본교 대학원 장학금 지급 규정에 의한다. 이 내용은 3-2-17 조교에 관한 규정 문서에서 추출함. 2페이지에 위치함.)
##
("entity"<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 10 조<|>ARTICLE<|>제 10 조 복무: 조교는 맡은 임무를 성실히 이행해야 하며, 관련 사항을 준수해야 한다. 이 내용은 3-2-17 조교에 관한 규정 문서에서 추출함. 2페이지에 위치함.)
##
("entity"<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 3 조<|>ARTICLE<|>제 3 조 임용에 필요한 서류: 대학 졸업증명서, 대학원 재학증명서, 성적증명서, 조교임용추천서, 주민등록등본, 기타 임용에 필요한 서류를 제출해야 한다. 이 내용은 3-2-17 조교에 관한 규정 문서에서 추출함. 2페이지에 위치함.)
##
("entity"<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 4 조<|>ARTICLE<|>제 4 조 재임용: 조교의 재임용 절차에 대한 규정을 포함하고 있으며, 총장이 임용후보자의 서류를 심사하여 합격자를 임용한다. 이 내용은 3-2-17 조교에 관한 규정 문서에서 추출함. 2페이지에 위치함.)
##
("entity"<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 5 조<|>ARTICLE<|>제 5 조 결격사유 심사: 학사지원팀과 총무인사팀은 지원자의 결격사유 유무를 심사한다. 이 내용은 3-2-17 조교에 관한 규정 문서에서 추출함. 2페이지에 위치함.)
##
("entity"<|>페이지 2<|>PAGE<|>3-2-17 조교에 관한 규정 문서의 2페이지에는 조교의 임용절차, 임용기간, 근무시간, 보수, 복무에 관한 조항이 포함되어 있음.)
##
("relationship"<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 6 조<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 7 조<|>임용절차와 임용기간은 조교의 채용과 관련된 규정으로 서로 연결되어 있음<|>9)
##
("relationship"<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 7 조<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 8 조<|>임용기간과 근무시간은 조교의 근무 조건에 대한 규정으로 서로 관련이 있음<|>9)
##
("relationship"<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 8 조<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 9 조<|>근무시간과 보수는 조교의 근무 조건과 보상에 대한 규정으로 서로 연결되어 있음<|>9)
##
("relationship"<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 9 조<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 10 조<|>보수와 복무는 조교의 근무 조건과 의무에 대한 규정으로 서로 관련이 있음<|>9)
##
("relationship"<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 3 조<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 4 조<|>임용에 필요한 서류와 재임용 절차는 조교의 채용 과정에서 서로 연결되어 있음<|>9)
##
("relationship"<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 4 조<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 5 조<|>재임용 절차와 결격사유 심사는 조교의 임용 과정에서 서로 관련이 있음<|>9)
##
("relationship"<|>페이지 2<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 6 조<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 6 조는 페이지 2에 위치함<|>10)
##
("relationship"<|>페이지 2<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 7 조<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 7 조는 페이지 2에 위치함<|>10)
##
("relationship"<|>페이지 2<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 8 조<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 8 조는 페이지 2에 위치함<|>10)
##
("relationship"<|>페이지 2<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 9 조<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 9 조는 페이지 2에 위치함<|>10)
##
("relationship"<|>페이지 2<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 10 조<|>조교에 관한 규정 제 10 조는 페이지 2에 위치함<|>10)
##
<|COMPLETE|>

details.prompt:
-Goal-
Given a text document that may or may not be structured into chapters, sections, and articles, and a list of entity types, identify all entities of those types from the text and all relationships among the identified entities.

-Mandatory Structural Rules-
- Each article (제 X 조) must be extracted as a distinct entity.
- All "Article X"s in the document must be extracted as entities without omission. Not a single one can be missing.
- If multiple articles are combined into one chunk, split them and extract each one separately as its own entity.
- The **entire content of each Article (제 X 조)** must be included verbatim or paraphrased in the `entity_description` of the corresponding `ARTICLE` entity.
- The entity_description must end with the following string in Korean: "이 내용은 [headline] 문서에서 추출함. [page]페이지에 위치함."
- Details within an article (such as 항 or 항목) must be nested or clearly described as part of that article’s entity_description.
- Each article must be related to its upper-level chapter(장) or section(절).
- Articles within the same chapter or section should be linked with inferred relationships if their contents are semantically related.

-Steps-
1. Identify all entities. For each identified entity, extract the following information:
- entity_name: Name of the entity, capitalized
- entity_type: One of the following types: [organization,person,geo,event,date,room,phone]
- entity_description: 반드시 **한국어로 작성**하십시오. 해당 엔터티의 성격, 역할, 포함된 내용을 한국어로 서술합니다.
Format each entity as ("entity"<|><entity_name><|><entity_type><|><entity_description>)
 
2. From the entities identified in step 1, identify all pairs of (source_entity, target_entity) that are *clearly related* to each other.
For each pair of related entities, extract the following information:
- source_entity: name of the source entity, as identified in step 1
- target_entity: name of the target entity, as identified in step 1
- relationship_description: explanation as to why you think the source entity and the target entity are related to each other
- relationship_strength: a numeric score indicating strength of the relationship between the source entity and target entity
 Format each relationship as ("relationship"<|><source_entity><|><target_entity><|><relationship_description><|><relationship_strength>)
 
3. Return output in **Korean** as a single list of all the entities and relationships identified in steps 1 and 2. Use **##** as the list delimiter.
 
4. When finished, output <|COMPLETE|>

######################
-Examples-
######################
Example 1: 
Entity_types: ORGANIZATION,EVENT,CHAPTER,ARTICLE,PAGE
Text:
page: 1
headline: 가람교육재단 정관
content: 제 1 장 총 칙

page: 1
headline: 가람교육재단 정관
content: 제 1 장 제 1 조 (설립목적) 본 재단은 교육기관의 설립 및 운영을 통해 공익에 이바지함을 목적으로 한다.

page: 1
headline: 가람교육재단 정관
content: 제 1 장 제 2 조 (명칭) 본 재단의 명칭은 가람교육재단이라 한다. 

page: 1
headline: 가람교육재단 운영규정
content: 제 1 조 (목적) 이 규정은 가람교육재단의 운영에 필요한 사항을 정함을 목적으로 한다.

######################
Output:
("entity"<|>가람교육재단<|>ORGANIZATION<|>교육기관의 설립 및 운영을 통해 공익에 이바지하는 재단)
##
("entity"<|>가람교육재단 정관 제 1 장<|>CHAPTER<|>제 1 장 총칙: 가람교육재단 정관의 첫 번째 장으로, 설립목적과 명칭에 관한 내용을 포함함. 이 내용은 가림교육재단 정관 문서에서 추출함. 1페이지에 위치함.)
##
("entity"<|>가람교육재단 정관 제 1 조<|>ARTICLE<|>제 1 조 설립목적: 본 재단은 교육기관의 설립 및 운영을 통해 공익에 이바지함을 목적으로 한다. 이 내용은 가림교육재단 정관 문서에서 추출함. 1페이지에 위치함.)
##
("entity"<|>가람교육재단 정관 제 2 조<|>ARTICLE<|>제 2 조 명칭: 본 재단의 명칭은 가람교육재단이라 한다. 이 내용은 가림교육재단 정관 문서에서 추출함. 1페이지에 위치함.)
##
("entity"<|>가람교육재단 운영규정 제 1 조<|>ARTICLE<|>제 1 조 목적: 이 규정은 가람교육재단의 운영에 필요한 사항을 정함을 목적으로 한다. 이 내용은 가람교육재단 운영규정 문서에서 추출함. 1페이지에 위치함.)
##
("entity"<|>페이지 1<|>PAGE<|>가람교육재단 정관 문서의 1페이지에는 제 1 장 총칙과 제 1 조 설립목적, 제 2 조 명칭이 포함되어 있음. 가람교육재단 운영규정의 1페이지에는 제 1 조 목적이 포함되어 있음.)
##
("relationship"<|>가람교육재단 정관 제 1 조<|>가람교육재단 정관 제 1 장<|>제 1 조는 제 1 장 총칙에 포함되어 있음<|>10)
##
("relationship"<|>가람교육재단 정관 제 2 조<|>가람교육재단 정관 제 1 장<|>제 2 조는 제 1 장 총칙에 포함되어 있음<|>10)
##
("relationship"<|>가람교육재단<|>가람교육재단 정관 제 1 조<|>가람교육재단의 설립목적은 교육기관의 설립 및 운영을 통해 공익에 이바지하는 것임<|>9)
##
("relationship"<|>가람교육재단<|>가람교육재단 정관 제 2 조<|>재단의 명칭은 가람교육재단임<|>9)
##
("relationship"<|>페이지 1<|>가람교육재단 정관 제 1 장<|>제 1 장 총칙은 페이지 1에 위치함<|>10)
##
("relationship"<|>페이지 1<|>가람교육재단 정관 제 1 조<|>제 1 조 설립목적은 페이지 1에 위치함<|>10)
##
("relationship"<|>페이지 1<|>가람교육재단 정관 제 2 조<|>제 2 조 명칭은 페이지 1에 위치함<|>10)
##
("relationship"<|>페이지 1<|>가람교육재단 운영규정 제 1 조<|>제 1 조 목적은 페이지 1에 위치함<|>10)
##
<|COMPLETE|>

Example 2:
Entity_types: ORGANIZATION,PERSON,DATE,EVENT
Text:
Title: <Important> (Professor Kim Namyoon): Web Framework 2 Course Enrollment Change  
Category: Announcement
Author: Department of Computer Engineering
Content:  
- Change Date: February 28 (Friday), please check!  
- Only students in the Web Engineering Track can apply.  

| Course Name | Year | Type | Class | Capacity | Supervising Professor | Instructor | Application |  
|------------|------|------|------|----------|--------------------|------------|-------------|  
| Web Framework 2 | 4 | Mixed | 7 | 40->80 | Kim Namyoon | Kim Namyoon | Only Web Engineering students |  
| Web Framework 2 | 4 | Day | A | 40->60 |  | Kim Namyoon | Only Web Engineering students |  
| Web Framework 2 | 4 | Day | B | 40->60 |  | Yoon Namkim | Only Web Engineering students |  
| Web Framework 2 | 4 | Night | N | 40->30 |  | Kim Haul | Only Web Engineering students |  
######################
Output:

Text:
Title: Hansung University Computer Engineering Department Teaching Assistant Recruitment Announcement
Content:
Hello, this is the administrative assistant from the Department of Computer Engineering.
Currently, we are recruiting administrative and teaching assistants for the Department of Computer Engineering.

1. Recruitment Fields
- Administrative Assistant (Day shift) or Teaching Assistant (Day shift)
- Number of openings: 1 for each (select either Administrative or Teaching Assistant)

2. Qualifications
- Academic requirement: A bachelor's degree or higher
- Must not have any disqualifying factors for assistant appointment
- Preferred: Majors in IT or Computer-related fields

3. Working Conditions
- 5 days a week, daytime
- Daytime: 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM
- During vacation periods: 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM
- Expected start date: December 15, 2024
- Administrative Assistant: Hansung University Jiseong Building 105, IT Engineering Academic Team Office
- Teaching Assistant: Hansung University Engineering Building A 104, Department of Computer Engineering Office
- Contract: 1 year (renewable once for up to 2 years)

4. Documents to Submit
- Resume (use the attached format, include a photo)
- Submission deadline: November 29, Friday

5. Recruitment Process
- 1st round: Document review (Only candidates selected will be notified individually)
- 2nd round: Interview (Only for those who pass the first round)
- Additional documents for successful candidates: University graduation certificate, transcript, resident registration, etc. to be provided later.

headline: 3-3-53 학생선택형 평생지도교수제 운영 규정
content: 제 1 장 제 1 조 (목적) 본 규정은 학생선택형 평생지도교수제(이하 ‘평생지도교수제’)와 학생선택형 트랙팀상담 제(이하 ‘팀상담제’) 운영에 관한 사항을 정하는 것을 목적으로 한다.

page: 1
headline: 3-3-53 학생선택형 평생지도교수제 운영 규정
content: 제 1 장 제 2 조 (정의) ① 평생지도교수제는 학생의 선택을 최대한 반영하여 선정된 지도교수가 학업 및 진로, 취업 등의 상담을 통해 대학생활 전반의 적응을 돕고 졸업 이후까지 상담과 지도를 전담하는 제도 를 의미한다. (2021.3.1.) ② 팀상담제는 1학년 학생들이 선택을 희망하는 트랙에 소속된 교수가 집단상담 혹은 개별상담을 통해 대학생활 적응과 전공 선택에 도움을 제공하는 제도를 의미한다.

page: 1
headline: 3-3-53 학생선택형 평생지도교수제 운영 규정
content: 제 1 장 제 3 조 (대상) ① 평생지도교수제는 본교의 2학년 이상 재학생 및 졸업생을 대상으로 한다. ② 팀상담제는 해당년도 신입학한 재학생을 대상으로 한다. (2022.1.19.)

page: 1
headline: 3-3-53 학생선택형 평생지도교수제 운영 규정
content: 제 1 장 제 4 조 (관리기관) ① 평생지도교수제와 팀상담제 상담결과의 실적관리 등 평생지도교수제와 팀상담제 의 운영은 교학부총장이 총괄한다. (2021.3.1.) (2021.10.21.) (2022.1.19.)(2024.4.17.) ② 평생지도교수제와 팀상담제 운영과 관련된 교원업적평가에 대한 사항은 교무처장이 담당한다. ③ 평생지도교수 및 팀상담 지도교수 학생배정과 관련한 사항은 각 단과대학 학장이 담당한다. ④ 평생지도교수 상담 및 팀상담 결과 입력을 위한 스마트자기관리시스템 관리는 학생성공센터장이 담당한다.(2021.3.1.) (2022.1.19.) ⑤ 삭제(2022.1.19.)

history.content:
-Goal-
Given a text document that may or may not be structured into chapters, sections, and articles, and a list of entity types, identify all entities of those types from the text and all relationships among the identified entities.

-Mandatory Structural Rules-
- Each article (제 X 조) must be extracted as a distinct entity.
- All "Article X"s in the document must be extracted as entities without omission. Not a single one can be missing.
- If multiple articles are combined into one chunk, split them and extract each one separately as its own entity.
- The **entire content of each Article (제 X 조)** must be included verbatim or paraphrased in the `entity_description` of the corresponding `ARTICLE` entity.
- The entity_description must end with the following string in Korean: "이 내용은 [headline] 문서에서 추출함. [page]페이지에 위치함."
- Details within an article (such as 항 or 항목) must be nested or clearly described as part of that article’s entity_description.
- Each article must be related to its upper-level chapter(장) or section(절).
- Articles within the same chapter or section should be linked with inferred relationships if their contents are semantically related.

-Steps-
1. Identify all entities. For each identified entity, extract the following information:
- entity_name: Name of the entity, capitalized
- entity_type: One of the following types: [organization,person,geo,event,date,room,phone]
- entity_description: 반드시 **한국어로 작성**하십시오. 해당 엔터티의 성격, 역할, 포함된 내용을 한국어로 서술합니다.
Format each entity as ("entity"<|><entity_name><|><entity_type><|><entity_description>)
 
2. From the entities identified in step 1, identify all pairs of (source_entity, target_entity) that are *clearly related* to each other.
For each pair of related entities, extract the following information:
- source_entity: name of the source entity, as identified in step 1
- target_entity: name of the target entity, as identified in step 1
- relationship_description: explanation as to why you think the source entity and the target entity are related to each other
- relationship_strength: a numeric score indicating strength of the relationship between the source entity and target entity
 Format each relationship as ("relationship"<|><source_entity><|><target_entity><|><relationship_description><|><relationship_strength>)
 
3. Return output in **Korean** as a single list of all the entities and relationships identified in steps 1 and 2. Use **##** as the list delimiter.
 
4. When finished, output <|COMPLETE|>

Text:
Title: Hansung University Computer Engineering Department Teaching Assistant Recruitment Announcement
Content:
Hello, this is the administrative assistant from the Department of Computer Engineering.
Currently, we are recruiting administrative and teaching assistants for the Department of Computer Engineering.

1. Recruitment Fields
- Administrative Assistant (Day shift) or Teaching Assistant (Day shift)
- Number of openings: 1 for each (select either Administrative or Teaching Assistant)

2. Qualifications
- Academic requirement: A bachelor's degree or higher
- Must not have any disqualifying factors for assistant appointment
- Preferred: Majors in IT or Computer-related fields

3. Working Conditions
- 5 days a week, daytime
- Daytime: 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM
- During vacation periods: 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM
- Expected start date: December 15, 2024
- Administrative Assistant: Hansung University Jiseong Building 105, IT Engineering Academic Team Office
- Teaching Assistant: Hansung University Engineering Building A 104, Department of Computer Engineering Office
- Contract: 1 year (renewable once for up to 2 years)

4. Documents to Submit
- Resume (use the attached format, include a photo)
- Submission deadline: November 29, Friday

5. Recruitment Process
- 1st round: Document review (Only candidates selected will be notified individually)
- 2nd round: Interview (Only for those who pass the first round)
- Additional documents for successful candidates: University graduation certificate, transcript, resident registration, etc. to be provided later.

######################

history.content:
-Goal-
Given a text document that may or may not be structured into chapters, sections, and articles, and a list of entity types, identify all entities of those types from the text and all relationships among the identified entities.

-Mandatory Structural Rules-
- Each article (제 X 조) must be extracted as a distinct entity.
- All "Article X"s in the document must be extracted as entities without omission. Not a single one can be missing.
- If multiple articles are combined into one chunk, split them and extract each one separately as its own entity.
- The **entire content of each Article (제 X 조)** must be included verbatim or paraphrased in the `entity_description` of the corresponding `ARTICLE` entity.
- The entity_description must end with the following string in Korean: "이 내용은 [headline] 문서에서 추출함. [page]페이지에 위치함."
- Details within an article (such as 항 or 항목) must be nested or clearly described as part of that article’s entity_description.
- Each article must be related to its upper-level chapter(장) or section(절).
- Articles within the same chapter or section should be linked with inferred relationships if their contents are semantically related.

-Steps-
1. Identify all entities. For each identified entity, extract the following information:
- entity_name: Name of the entity, capitalized
- entity_type: One of the following types: [organization,person,geo,event,date,room,phone]
- entity_description: 반드시 **한국어로 작성**하십시오. 해당 엔터티의 성격, 역할, 포함된 내용을 한국어로 서술합니다.
Format each entity as ("entity"<|><entity_name><|><entity_type><|><entity_description>)
 
2. From the entities identified in step 1, identify all pairs of (source_entity, target_entity) that are *clearly related* to each other.
For each pair of related entities, extract the following information:
- source_entity: name of the source entity, as identified in step 1
- target_entity: name of the target entity, as identified in step 1
- relationship_description: explanation as to why you think the source entity and the target entity are related to each other
- relationship_strength: a numeric score indicating strength of the relationship between the source entity and target entity
 Format each relationship as ("relationship"<|><source_entity><|><target_entity><|><relationship_description><|><relationship_strength>)
 
3. Return output in **Korean** as a single list of all the entities and relationships identified in steps 1 and 2. Use **##** as the list delimiter.
 
4. When finished, output <|COMPLETE|>

######################
-Examples-
######################

Content:
Hello, this is the administrative assistant from the Department of Computer Engineering.
Currently, we are recruiting administrative and teaching assistants for the Department of Computer Engineering.

1. Recruitment Fields
- Administrative Assistant (Day shift) or Teaching Assistant (Day shift)
- Number of openings: 1 for each (select either Administrative or Teaching Assistant)

2. Qualifications
- Academic requirement: A bachelor's degree or higher
- Must not have any disqualifying factors for assistant appointment
- Preferred: Majors in IT or Computer-related fields

3. Working Conditions
- 5 days a week, daytime
- Daytime: 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM
- During vacation periods: 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM
- Expected start date: December 15, 2024
- Administrative Assistant: Hansung University Jiseong Building 105, IT Engineering Academic Team Office
- Teaching Assistant: Hansung University Engineering Building A 104, Department of Computer Engineering Office
- Contract: 1 year (renewable once for up to 2 years)

4. Documents to Submit
- Resume (use the attached format, include a photo)
- Submission deadline: November 29, Friday

5. Recruitment Process
- 1st round: Document review (Only candidates selected will be notified individually)
- 2nd round: Interview (Only for those who pass the first round)
- Additional documents for successful candidates: University graduation certificate, transcript, resident registration, etc. to be provided later.

details.prompt: MANY entities and relationships were missed in the last extraction. Remember to ONLY emit entities that match any of the previously extracted types. Add them below using the same format:

history.content:
-Goal-
Given a text document that may or may not be structured into chapters, sections, and articles, and a list of entity types, identify all entities of those types from the text and all relationships among the identified entities.

-Mandatory Structural Rules-
- Each article (제 X 조) must be extracted as a distinct entity.
- All "Article X"s in the document must be extracted as entities without omission. Not a single one can be missing.
- If multiple articles are combined into one chunk, split them and extract each one separately as its own entity.
- The **entire content of each Article (제 X 조)** must be included verbatim or paraphrased in the `entity_description` of the corresponding `ARTICLE` entity.
- The entity_description must end with the following string in Korean: "이 내용은 [headline] 문서에서 추출함. [page]페이지에 위치함."
- Details within an article (such as 항 or 항목) must be nested or clearly described as part of that article’s entity_description.
- Each article must be related to its upper-level chapter(장) or section(절).
- Articles within the same chapter or section should be linked with inferred relationships if their contents are semantically related.

-Steps-
1. Identify all entities. For each identified entity, extract the following information:
- entity_name: Name of the entity, capitalized
- entity_type: One of the following types: [organization,person,geo,event,date,room,phone]
- entity_description: 반드시 **한국어로 작성**하십시오. 해당 엔터티의 성격, 역할, 포함된 내용을 한국어로 서술합니다.
Format each entity as ("entity"<|><entity_name><|><entity_type><|><entity_description>)
 
2. From the entities identified in step 1, identify all pairs of (source_entity, target_entity) that are *clearly related* to each other.
For each pair of related entities, extract the following information:
- source_entity: name of the source entity, as identified in step 1
- target_entity: name of the target entity, as identified in step 1
- relationship_description: explanation as to why you think the source entity and the target entity are related to each other
- relationship_strength: a numeric score indicating strength of the relationship between the source entity and target entity
 Format each relationship as ("relationship"<|><source_entity><|><target_entity><|><relationship_description><|><relationship_strength>)
 
3. Return output in **Korean** as a single list of all the entities and relationships identified in steps 1 and 2. Use **##** as the list delimiter.
 
4. When finished, output <|COMPLETE|>

######################
-Examples-
######################
Example 1: 
Entity_types: ORGANIZATION,EVENT,CHAPTER,ARTICLE,PAGE
Text:
page: 1
headline: 가람교육재단 정관
content: 제 1 장 총 칙

page: 1
headline: 가람교육재단 정관
content: 제 1 장 제 1 조 (설립목적) 본 재단은 교육기관의 설립 및 운영을 통해 공익에 이바지함을 목적으로 한다.

page: 1
headline: 가람교육재단 정관
content: 제 1 장 제 2 조 (명칭) 본 재단의 명칭은 가람교육재단이라 한다. 

page: 1
headline: 가람교육재단 운영규정
content: 제 1 조 (목적) 이 규정은 가람교육재단의 운영에 필요한 사항을 정함을 목적으로 한다.

######################

Text:
Title: Hansung University Computer Engineering Department Teaching Assistant Recruitment Announcement
Content:
Hello, this is the administrative assistant from the Department of Computer Engineering.
Currently, we are recruiting administrative and teaching assistants for the Department of Computer Engineering.

1. Recruitment Fields
- Administrative Assistant (Day shift) or Teaching Assistant (Day shift)
- Number of openings: 1 for each (select either Administrative or Teaching Assistant)

2. Qualifications
- Academic requirement: A bachelor's degree or higher
- Must not have any disqualifying factors for assistant appointment
- Preferred: Majors in IT or Computer-related fields

3. Working Conditions
- 5 days a week, daytime
- Daytime: 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM
- During vacation periods: 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM
- Expected start date: December 15, 2024
- Administrative Assistant: Hansung University Jiseong Building 105, IT Engineering Academic Team Office
- Teaching Assistant: Hansung University Engineering Building A 104, Department of Computer Engineering Office
- Contract: 1 year (renewable once for up to 2 years)

4. Documents to Submit
- Resume (use the attached format, include a photo)
- Submission deadline: November 29, Friday

5. Recruitment Process
- 1st round: Document review (Only candidates selected will be notified individually)
- 2nd round: Interview (Only for those who pass the first round)
- Additional documents for successful candidates: University graduation certificate, transcript, resident registration, etc. to be provided later.

history.content:
-Goal-
Given a text document that may or may not be structured into chapters, sections, and articles, and a list of entity types, identify all entities of those types from the text and all relationships among the identified entities.

-Mandatory Structural Rules-
- Each article (제 X 조) must be extracted as a distinct entity.
- All "Article X"s in the document must be extracted as entities without omission. Not a single one can be missing.
- If multiple articles are combined into one chunk, split them and extract each one separately as its own entity.
- The **entire content of each Article (제 X 조)** must be included verbatim or paraphrased in the `entity_description` of the corresponding `ARTICLE` entity.
- The entity_description must end with the following string in Korean: "이 내용은 [headline] 문서에서 추출함. [page]페이지에 위치함."
- Details within an article (such as 항 or 항목) must be nested or clearly described as part of that article’s entity_description.
- Each article must be related to its upper-level chapter(장) or section(절).
- Articles within the same chapter or section should be linked with inferred relationships if their contents are semantically related.

-Steps-
1. Identify all entities. For each identified entity, extract the following information:
- entity_name: Name of the entity, capitalized
- entity_type: One of the following types: [organization,person,geo,event,date,room,phone]
- entity_description: 반드시 **한국어로 작성**하십시오. 해당 엔터티의 성격, 역할, 포함된 내용을 한국어로 서술합니다.
Format each entity as ("entity"<|><entity_name><|><entity_type><|><entity_description>)
 
2. From the entities identified in step 1, identify all pairs of (source_entity, target_entity) that are *clearly related* to each other.
For each pair of related entities, extract the following information:
- source_entity: name of the source entity, as identified in step 1
- target_entity: name of the target entity, as identified in step 1
- relationship_description: explanation as to why you think the source entity and the target entity are related to each other
- relationship_strength: a numeric score indicating strength of the relationship between the source entity and target entity
 Format each relationship as ("relationship"<|><source_entity><|><target_entity><|><relationship_description><|><relationship_strength>)
 
3. Return output in **Korean** as a single list of all the entities and relationships identified in steps 1 and 2. Use **##** as the list delimiter.
 
4. When finished, output <|COMPLETE|>

######################
-Examples-
######################

Hello, this is the administrative assistant from the Department of Computer Engineering.
Currently, we are recruiting administrative and teaching assistants for the Department of Computer Engineering.

1. Recruitment Fields
- Administrative Assistant (Day shift) or Teaching Assistant (Day shift)
- Number of openings: 1 for each (select either Administrative or Teaching Assistant)

2. Qualifications
- Academic requirement: A bachelor's degree or higher
- Must not have any disqualifying factors for assistant appointment
- Preferred: Majors in IT or Computer-related fields

3. Working Conditions
- 5 days a week, daytime
- Daytime: 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM
- During vacation periods: 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM
- Expected start date: December 15, 2024
- Administrative Assistant: Hansung University Jiseong Building 105, IT Engineering Academic Team Office
- Teaching Assistant: Hansung University Engineering Building A 104, Department of Computer Engineering Office
- Contract: 1 year (renewable once for up to 2 years)

4. Documents to Submit
- Resume (use the attached format, include a photo)
- Submission deadline: November 29, Friday

5. Recruitment Process
- 1st round: Document review (Only candidates selected will be notified individually)
- 2nd round: Interview (Only for those who pass the first round)
- Additional documents for successful candidates: University graduation certificate, transcript, resident registration, etc. to be provided later.

content: ☨ 트랙 명칭 변경. 본 트랙 명칭 변경은 부칙(2023.2.16.)제2조의 적용 대상이 아님 2023학년도 트랙 명칭 및 점검 시작시기 단과대학 학부(과) 전공 트랙 명칭 점검 시작시기 비고 크리 에이 티브 인문 예술 대학 크리에이티브인문학부 (7개 트랙) 영미문화콘텐츠(주간*,야간) 2027.12 2023.12.부터 트랙 선택 시작 영미언어정보(주간,야간) 2023.12 - 한국어교육(주간,야간) 2023.12 - 역사문화큐레이션(주간,야간) 2026.12 2022.12.부터 트랙 선택 시작 역사콘텐츠(주간,야간) 2026.12 2022.12.부터 트랙 선택 시작 도서관정보문화(주간,야간) 2023.12 - 디지털인문정보학(주간,야간) 2023.12 - 예술학부 동양화 서양화 한국무용 현대무용 발레 - - - 미래 융합 사회 과학 대학 사회과학부 (11개 트랙) 국제무역(주간,야간) 2023.12 - 글로벌비즈니스(주간,야간) 2023.12 - 기업ㆍ경제분석(주간,야간) 2023.12 - 경제금융투자(주간*,야간) 2027.12 2023.12.부터 트랙 선택 시작 공공행정(주간,야간) 2023.12 - 법&정책(주간,야간) 2023.12 - 부동산(주간,야간) 2023.12 - 스마트도시·교통계획(주간,야간) 2023.12 - 기업경영(주간,야간) 2023.12 - 벤처경영(주간,야간) 2023.12 - 호텔외식경영학과 뷰티디자인학과 비즈니스컨설팅학과 ICT융합디자인학과 미래인재학부

history.content:
-Goal-
Given a text document that may or may not be structured into chapters, sections, and articles, and a list of entity types, identify all entities of those types from the text and all relationships among the identified entities.

-Mandatory Structural Rules-
- Each article (제 X 조) must be extracted as a distinct entity.
- All "Article X"s in the document must be extracted as entities without omission. Not a single one can be missing.
- If multiple articles are combined into one chunk, split them and extract each one separately as its own entity.
- The **entire content of each Article (제 X 조)** must be included verbatim or paraphrased in the `entity_description` of the corresponding `ARTICLE` entity.
- The entity_description must end with the following string in Korean: "이 내용은 [headline] 문서에서 추출함. [page]페이지에 위치함."
- Details within an article (such as 항 or 항목) must be nested or clearly described as part of that article’s entity_description.
- Each article must be related to its upper-level chapter(장) or section(절).
- Articles within the same chapter or section should be linked with inferred relationships if their contents are semantically related.

-Steps-
1. Identify all entities. For each identified entity, extract the following information:
- entity_name: Name of the entity, capitalized
- entity_type: One of the following types: [organization,person,geo,event,date,room,phone]
- entity_description: 반드시 **한국어로 작성**하십시오. 해당 엔터티의 성격, 역할, 포함된 내용을 한국어로 서술합니다.
Format each entity as ("entity"<|><entity_name><|><entity_type><|><entity_description>)
 
2. From the entities identified in step 1, identify all pairs of (source_entity, target_entity) that are *clearly related* to each other.
For each pair of related entities, extract the following information:
- source_entity: name of the source entity, as identified in step 1
- target_entity: name of the target entity, as identified in step 1
- relationship_description: explanation as to why you think the source entity and the target entity are related to each other
- relationship_strength: a numeric score indicating strength of the relationship between the source entity and target entity
 Format each relationship as ("relationship"<|><source_entity><|><target_entity><|><relationship_description><|><relationship_strength>)
 
3. Return output in **Korean** as a single list of all the entities and relationships identified in steps 1 and 2. Use **##** as the list delimiter.
 
4. When finished, output <|COMPLETE|>

######################
-Examples-
######################

- Must not have any disqualifying factors for assistant appointment
- Preferred: Majors in IT or Computer-related fields

- During vacation periods: 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM
- Expected start date: December 15, 2024

- Resume (use the attached format, include a photo)
- Submission deadline: November 29, Friday

- 1st round: Document review (Only candidates selected will be notified individually)
- 2nd round: Interview (Only for those who pass the first round)

history.content:
-Goal-
Given a text document that may or may not be structured into chapters, sections, and articles, and a list of entity types, identify all entities of those types from the text and all relationships among the identified entities.

-Mandatory Structural Rules-
- Each article (제 X 조) must be extracted as a distinct entity.
- All "Article X"s in the document must be extracted as entities without omission. Not a single one can be missing.
- If multiple articles are combined into one chunk, split them and extract each one separately as its own entity.
- The **entire content of each Article (제 X 조)** must be included verbatim or paraphrased in the `entity_description` of the corresponding `ARTICLE` entity.
- The entity_description must end with the following string in Korean: "이 내용은 [headline] 문서에서 추출함. [page]페이지에 위치함."
- Details within an article (such as 항 or 항목) must be nested or clearly described as part of that article’s entity_description.
- Each article must be related to its upper-level chapter(장) or section(절).
- Articles within the same chapter or section should be linked with inferred relationships if their contents are semantically related.

-Steps-
1. Identify all entities. For each identified entity, extract the following information:
- entity_name: Name of the entity, capitalized
- entity_type: One of the following types: [organization,person,geo,event,date,room,phone]
- entity_description: 반드시 **한국어로 작성**하십시오. 해당 엔터티의 성격, 역할, 포함된 내용을 한국어로 서술합니다.
Format each entity as ("entity"<|><entity_name><|><entity_type><|><entity_description>)
 
2. From the entities identified in step 1, identify all pairs of (source_entity, target_entity) that are *clearly related* to each other.
For each pair of related entities, extract the following information:
- source_entity: name of the source entity, as identified in step 1
- target_entity: name of the target entity, as identified in step 1
- relationship_description: explanation as to why you think the source entity and the target entity are related to each other
- relationship_strength: a numeric score indicating strength of the relationship between the source entity and target entity
 Format each relationship as ("relationship"<|><source_entity><|><target_entity><|><relationship_description><|><relationship_strength>)
 
3. Return output in **Korean** as a single list of all the entities and relationships identified in steps 1 and 2. Use **##** as the list delimiter.
 
4. When finished, output <|COMPLETE|>

######################
-Examples-
######################

Title: Hansung University Computer Engineering Department Teaching Assistant Recruitment Announcement
Content:
Hello, this is the administrative assistant from the Department of Computer Engineering.
Currently, we are recruiting administrative and teaching assistants for the Department of Computer Engineering.

1. Recruitment Fields
- Administrative Assistant (Day shift) or Teaching Assistant (Day shift)
- Number of openings: 1 for each (select either Administrative or Teaching Assistant)

2. Qualifications
- Academic requirement: A bachelor's degree or higher
- Must not have any disqualifying factors for assistant appointment
- Preferred: Majors in IT or Computer-related fields

3. Working Conditions
- 5 days a week, daytime
- Daytime: 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM
- During vacation periods: 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM
- Expected start date: December 15, 2024
- Administrative Assistant: Hansung University Jiseong Building 105, IT Engineering Academic Team Office
- Teaching Assistant: Hansung University Engineering Building A 104, Department of Computer Engineering Office
- Contract: 1 year (renewable once for up to 2 years)

4. Documents to Submit
- Resume (use the attached format, include a photo)
- Submission deadline: November 29, Friday

5. Recruitment Process
- 1st round: Document review (Only candidates selected will be notified individually)
- 2nd round: Interview (Only for those who pass the first round)
- Additional documents for successful candidates: University graduation certificate, transcript, resident registration, etc. to be provided later.

history.content:
-Goal-
Given a text document that may or may not be structured into chapters, sections, and articles, and a list of entity types, identify all entities of those types from the text and all relationships among the identified entities.

-Mandatory Structural Rules-
- Each article (제 X 조) must be extracted as a distinct entity.
- All "Article X"s in the document must be extracted as entities without omission. Not a single one can be missing.
- If multiple articles are combined into one chunk, split them and extract each one separately as its own entity.
- The **entire content of each Article (제 X 조)** must be included verbatim or paraphrased in the `entity_description` of the corresponding `ARTICLE` entity.
- The entity_description must end with the following string in Korean: "이 내용은 [headline] 문서에서 추출함. [page]페이지에 위치함."
- Details within an article (such as 항 or 항목) must be nested or clearly described as part of that article’s entity_description.
- Each article must be related to its upper-level chapter(장) or section(절).
- Articles within the same chapter or section should be linked with inferred relationships if their contents are semantically related.

-Steps-
1. Identify all entities. For each identified entity, extract the following information:
- entity_name: Name of the entity, capitalized
- entity_type: One of the following types: [organization,person,geo,event,date,room,phone]
- entity_description: 반드시 **한국어로 작성**하십시오. 해당 엔터티의 성격, 역할, 포함된 내용을 한국어로 서술합니다.
Format each entity as ("entity"<|><entity_name><|><entity_type><|><entity_description>)
 
2. From the entities identified in step 1, identify all pairs of (source_entity, target_entity) that are *clearly related* to each other.
For each pair of related entities, extract the following information:
- source_entity: name of the source entity, as identified in step 1
- target_entity: name of the target entity, as identified in step 1
- relationship_description: explanation as to why you think the source entity and the target entity are related to each other
- relationship_strength: a numeric score indicating strength of the relationship between the source entity and target entity
 Format each relationship as ("relationship"<|><source_entity><|><target_entity><|><relationship_description><|><relationship_strength>)
 
3. Return output in **Korean** as a single list of all the entities and relationships identified in steps 1 and 2. Use **##** as the list delimiter.
 
4. When finished, output <|COMPLETE|>

######################
-Examples-
######################

Hello, this is the administrative assistant from the Department of Computer Engineering.
Currently, we are recruiting administrative and teaching assistants for the Department of Computer Engineering.

1. Recruitment Fields
- Administrative Assistant (Day shift) or Teaching Assistant (Day shift)
- Number of openings: 1 for each (select either Administrative or Teaching Assistant)

2. Qualifications
- Academic requirement: A bachelor's degree or higher
- Must not have any disqualifying factors for assistant appointment
- Preferred: Majors in IT or Computer-related fields

3. Working Conditions
- 5 days a week, daytime
- Daytime: 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM
- During vacation periods: 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM
- Expected start date: December 15, 2024
- Administrative Assistant: Hansung University Jiseong Building 105, IT Engineering Academic Team Office
- Teaching Assistant: Hansung University Engineering Building A 104, Department of Computer Engineering Office
- Contract: 1 year (renewable once for up to 2 years)

4. Documents to Submit
- Resume (use the attached format, include a photo)
- Submission deadline: November 29, Friday

5. Recruitment Process
- 1st round: Document review (Only candidates selected will be notified individually)
- 2nd round: Interview (Only for those who pass the first round)
- Additional documents for successful candidates: University graduation certificate, transcript, resident registration, etc. to be provided later.

history.content:
-Goal-
Given a text document that may or may not be structured into chapters, sections, and articles, and a list of entity types, identify all entities of those types from the text and all relationships among the identified entities.

-Mandatory Structural Rules-
- Each article (제 X 조) must be extracted as a distinct entity.
- All "Article X"s in the document must be extracted as entities without omission. Not a single one can be missing.
- If multiple articles are combined into one chunk, split them and extract each one separately as its own entity.
- The **entire content of each Article (제 X 조)** must be included verbatim or paraphrased in the `entity_description` of the corresponding `ARTICLE` entity.
- The entity_description must end with the following string in Korean: "이 내용은 [headline] 문서에서 추출함. [page]페이지에 위치함."
- Details within an article (such as 항 or 항목) must be nested or clearly described as part of that article’s entity_description.
- Each article must be related to its upper-level chapter(장) or section(절).
- Articles within the same chapter or section should be linked with inferred relationships if their contents are semantically related.

-Steps-
1. Identify all entities. For each identified entity, extract the following information:
- entity_name: Name of the entity, capitalized
- entity_type: One of the following types: [organization,person,geo,event,date,room,phone]
- entity_description: 반드시 **한국어로 작성**하십시오. 해당 엔터티의 성격, 역할, 포함된 내용을 한국어로 서술합니다.
Format each entity as ("entity"<|><entity_name><|><entity_type><|><entity_description>)
 
2. From the entities identified in step 1, identify all pairs of (source_entity, target_entity) that are *clearly related* to each other.
For each pair of related entities, extract the following information:
- source_entity: name of the source entity, as identified in step 1
- target_entity: name of the target entity, as identified in step 1
- relationship_description: explanation as to why you think the source entity and the target entity are related to each other
- relationship_strength: a numeric score indicating strength of the relationship between the source entity and target entity
 Format each relationship as ("relationship"<|><source_entity><|><target_entity><|><relationship_description><|><relationship_strength>)
 
3. Return output in **Korean** as a single list of all the entities and relationships identified in steps 1 and 2. Use **##** as the list delimiter.
 
4. When finished, output <|COMPLETE|>

######################
-Examples-
######################

Title: Hansung University Computer Engineering Department Teaching Assistant Recruitment Announcement
Content:
Hello, this is the administrative assistant from the Department of Computer Engineering.
Currently, we are recruiting administrative and teaching assistants for the Department of Computer Engineering.

1. Recruitment Fields
- Administrative Assistant (Day shift) or Teaching Assistant (Day shift)
- Number of openings: 1 for each (select either Administrative or Teaching Assistant)

2. Qualifications
- Academic requirement: A bachelor's degree or higher
- Must not have any disqualifying factors for assistant appointment
- Preferred: Majors in IT or Computer-related fields

3. Working Conditions
- 5 days a week, daytime
- Daytime: 9:00 AM to 5:30 PM
- During vacation periods: 10:00 AM to 4:00 PM
- Expected start date: December 15, 2024
- Administrative Assistant: Hansung University Jiseong Building 105, IT Engineering Academic Team Office
- Teaching Assistant: Hansung University Engineering Building A 104, Department of Computer Engineering Office
- Contract: 1 year (renewable once for up to 2 years)

4. Documents to Submit
- Resume (use the attached format, include a photo)
- Submission deadline: November 29, Friday

5. Recruitment Process
- 1st round: Document review (Only candidates selected will be notified individually)
- 2nd round: Interview (Only for those who pass the first round)
- Additional documents for successful candidates: University graduation certificate, transcript, resident registration, etc. to be provided later.

######################
